intro: Didymocheton hornei var. glabratus, commonly known as the smooth-flowered balsa, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and unique botanical features, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
